spc_charts package

Submodules

spc_charts.spc_charts module

Plotly charts for Statistical Process control

class spc_charts.spc_charts.Constants

Bases: object

Represents a table of constants for values of n from 2 to 100:

A, A2, A3, B3, B4, B5, B6, c4, d2, d3, D1, D2, D3, D4, E2

Methods:

constant()

constant(n, name)

Returns the value of the constant given the constant’s name and the value of n.

Parameters:

  • n – the value of n

  • name – the name of the constant

Returns:

the value of the constant

Raises:

Exception: if the constant is not found

class spc_charts.spc_charts.IndividualMR(title='', r_title='Range', x_title='Average', chart_width=800, chart_height=600)

Bases: XbarR

Shewart Individual and Moving Range chart

Methods:

fit() predict() plot() save() load() save_chart()

Properties:

params predicted

Parameters:

  • title – The chart title

  • r_title – The title for the y-axis of the range chart

  • x_title – The title for the y-axis of the mean chart

  • chart_width – The chart width in pixels, defaults to 800.

  • chart_height – The chart height in pixels, defaults to 600.

chart_type = 'IndividualMR'
fit(values, labels)

Calculates the control limits and center lines for the mean and range charts.

Parameters:

  • values (numpy.Array where each row is a subgroup and each column is a value in a subgroup.) – The values to be used to calculate the control limits. The subgroup size must be at least 2.

  • labels (list, tuple or array of strings) – The labels for each value

Raises:

ValueError: if there are missing values in values.

Raises:

ValueError: if there are more than one column in values.

has_r_lower_limit = False
static moving_ranges(values)

Calculates the moving ranges for a single dimension array

Parameters:

values – single dimension array of values

Returns:

numpy array

predict(values, labels)

Calculates the moving range values for plotting on the Range chart. Calculates whether the values and moving ranges are outside their respective limits.

Parameters:

  • values (list, tuple or array) – the values

  • labels (list, tuple or array of strings) – The labels for each value

Raises:

Exception: if the control limits have not been calculated.

Raises:

ValueError: if there are missing values in values.

Raises:

ValueError: if there are more than one column in values.

class spc_charts.spc_charts.Run(values, labels, title='', x_title='Average', chart_width=800, chart_height=600)

Bases: object

Run chart

methods:

save() plot()

Parameters:

  • values – The values to plot. Must be numpy.array like

  • labels – The labels for the values. Must be numpy.array like

  • title – The chart title

  • x_title – The title for the y-axis

  • chart_width – The chart width in pixels, defaults to 800.

  • chart_height – The chart height in pixels, defaults to 600.

property centre_line

Returns the value of the center line (median).

plot()

Plots the chart.

Raises:

ValueError: if there is no data to plot

save_chart(path)

Saves an image of the chart to a file.

Parameters:

path – The full path and filename to save to. The file type is automatically determined by the filename extension. Allowed files types are PNG, JPEG, WebP, SVG and PDF.

  • x_center – The value of the charts center line.

  • x_title – The title for the y-axis

  • width – The width of the chart in pixels

  • height – The height of the chart in pixels

Saves the chart as an image file

Parameters:

path – the full path and filename to save the file to.

class spc_charts.spc_charts.XRChart(x_values, labels, x_center, x_status, x_upper_limit, x_lower_limit, r_values, r_status, r_lower_limit, r_upper_limit, r_center, title, x_title, r_title, width, height, show_r_lower_limit)

Bases: object

Plotly chart for X and R

Methods:

draw() save()

Parameters:

  • x_values – the values to be plotted on the X chart

  • labels – the labels for the values plotted on the X and R charts

  • x_center – The center line of the X chart

  • x_status – Boolean array: whether the values in x_values are in control.

  • x_upper_limit – the upper limit for the X chart

  • x_lower_limit – the lower limit for the X chart

  • r_values – the values to be plotted on the R chart

  • r_status – Boolean array: whether the values in x_values are in control.

  • r_lower_limit – the lower limit of the R chart

  • r_upper_limit – the upper limit of the R chart

  • r_center – the center line of the R chart

  • title – the title for the chart

  • x_title – the title of the y-axis of the X chart

  • r_title – the title of the y-axis of the R chart

  • width – the width of the chart in pixels

  • height – the height of the chart in pixels

draw()

Creates a plotly chart and shows it.

save(path)

Saves the chart as an image file.

Parameters:

path – Path and filename to save the chart to.

class spc_charts.spc_charts.XbarR(title='', r_title='Range', x_title='Average', chart_width=800, chart_height=600)

Bases: object

Shewart Average and Range chart

Methods:

fit() predict() plot() save() load() save_chart()

Properties:

params predicted

Parameters:

  • title – The chart title

  • r_title – The title for the y-axis of the range chart

  • x_title – The title for the y-axis of the mean chart

  • chart_width – The chart width in pixels, defaults to 800.

  • chart_height – The chart height in pixels, defaults to 600.

chart_type = 'XBarR'
fit(values, labels)

Calculates the control limits and center lines for the mean and range charts.

Parameters:

  • values (numpy.Array where each row is a subgroup and each column is a value in a subgroup.) – The values to be used to calculate the control limits. The subgroup size must be at least 2.

  • labels (list, tuple or array of strings) – The labels for each subgroup

Raises:

ValueError: if there are missing values in values.

Raises:

ValueError: if there are less than 2 columns in values.

has_r_lower_limit = True
load(path)

Loads the chart parameters from a JSON file.

Parameters:

path – The full path and filename of the file to load

property params

Return or set the chart parameters as a dictionary:

  • n : the number of values in each subgroup

  • x_upper_limit: the upper limit for the X chart

  • x_lower_limit’: the lower limit for the X chart

  • x_center_line: the center line of the X chart

  • r_upper_limit: the upper limit of the R chart

  • r_lower_limit: the lower limit of the R chart

  • r_center_line: the center line of the R chart

  • title: the chart title

  • x_title: the title for the y-axis of the X chart

  • r_title: the title for the y-axis of the R chart

Parameters:

params – dictionary of the parameters

Returns:

dictionary

plot()

Plots the mean and range values on Plotly chart.

Raises:

ValueError: if there is no data to plot

predict(values, labels)

Transform subgroup values into mean and moving range values for plotting on a chart. Calculates whether the means and ranges are outside their respective limits.

Parameters:

  • values (list, tuple or array) – Each row is a subgroup and each column is a value of the subgroup.

  • labels (list, tuple or array of strings) – The labels for each subgroup

Raises:

Exception: if the control limits have not been calculated.

Raises:

ValueError: if there are missing values in values.

Raises:

ValueError: if the number of values in the subgroups used to calculate the control limits is different to the number of subgroups in values.

property predicted

A pandas DataFrame of the predicted data. Columns are:

  • labels: the labels for each value plotted.

  • x_values: the values plotted on the X chart.

  • r_values: the values plotted on the R chart.

  • x_in_control: True if the value plotted on the Averages chart is within the control limits.

  • r_in_control: True if the value plotted on the Range chart in within the control limits.

Returns:

pandas.DataFrame

save(path)

Saves the chart parameters to a json file.

Parameters:

path – The full path and filename.

save_chart(path)

Saves an image of the chart to a file.

Parameters:

path – The full path and filename to save to. The file type is automatically determined by the filename extension. Allowed files types are PNG, JPEG, WebP, SVG and PDF.

spc_charts.spc_charts.array_missing_values(values)

Check an array for missing values.

Parameters:

values – array of values

Raises:

ValueError: if there is a missing value
